column4: I'm running Ubuntu 6.06 Dapper (AMD64) on an HP Pavilion dv5000 laptop with an ATi Radeon Xpress 200M. I cannot get the binary drivers to work, they crash the system on boot, and cannot get anything to work with OpenGL. Is there a way to either do software-acceleration OpenGL, or somehow fix the problem with the binary video card driver?
software opengl is never accelerated :)
I can't get opengl to work period
are you running the amd64 version of ubuntu?
yes
I mentioned this in the big problem statement
the binary drivers work OK on my HP nx6125 (Mobile Sempron, same chipset)
well, could have been that you just wanted to point out which kind of processor you have...
understandable.
anyway, works fine with x86 (32 bit) ubuntu for me
well, do you have a 64-bit processor?
no. but I could simply swap the mobile sempron for a turion to have 64 bit capability...
and, from what I've heard so far, ubuntu amd64 causes a lot of problems so that you are usually better of using the 32 bit version
my advice, as I already told you: use ubuntu x86
Thank you for your advice, but I'd rather not
ok
but why not? AMD64 doesn't have any real benefits at the moment (besides being incredibly cool)
not true...math processing is faster
yeah... but not that much, especially not if the software hasn't been optimized for 64 bit processors
It will, eventually, and ATi has released 64 drivers, so that's not the problem
Well,
all ATi drivers are shit anyway
I would have gotten a Nvidia if I could
same here
